Details

Noise - this is an intangible object representing a sound.

A Noise object is generally placed directly within the object that is generating the noise. This will ensure that the noise is automatically in scope whenever the object is in scope (or, more precisely, whenever the object’s contents are in scope) and with the same sense attributes.

By default, when a noise is specifically examined via “listen to”, and the container is visible, we’ll mention that the noise is coming from the container.

class Noise :   SensoryEmanation

Properties  

isSoundListedInRoom

objects.t[668]

By default, a noise is listed in a room description (i.e., on LOOK or entry to a room) unless it’s an ambient background noise.. Set this to nil to omit the noise from the room description, while still allowing it to be heard in an explicit LISTEN command.

soundPresenceOVERRIDDEN

objects.t[660]

by default, we have a definite presence in the sound sense if we’re emanating our noise

Methods  

cannotSeeSource (obs)OVERRIDDEN

objects.t[674]

explain that we can’t see the source because of the obstructor

dobjFor(Examine)OVERRIDDEN

objects.t[680]

“examine” requires that the object is audible

dobjFor(ListenTo)OVERRIDDEN

objects.t[677]

treat “listen to” the same as “examine”

soundHereDesc ( )OVERRIDDEN

objects.t[671]

show our description as part of a room description
